intro: Crypsinus proteus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette of leaves at the base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
